text: The <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated signaling cascade is important for MTb induction of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in human monocytes .
( A ) Engagement of <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> significantly enhances <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA synthesis in monocytes .

THP-1 cells were incubated with the <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific ligand Pam3Cys ( 5 microg / ml ) , infected with MTb strain CDC1551 ( 1 : 1 cells : bacilli ) , or left untreated .
After 16 hours , <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were measured .
<extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression was significantly increased when the cells were incubated with Pam3Cys ( * , p < 0.05 ) or infected with MTb ( ** , p < 0.01 ) .
( B ) <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is important for MTb induction of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in human monocytes .

THP-1 cells that constitutively express lentivirally-delivered shRNA targeting <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or control shRNA targeting <extra_id_0> GFP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were constructed as described in Materials and Methods .
Cells were infected with MTb strain CDC1551 ( 1 : 1 cells : bacilli ) or left uninfected for 16 hours at 37degreesC , and RNA was analyzed .

<extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were significantly inhibited in the cells transduced with <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific shRNA ( black bars ) compared with the cells transduced with control shRNA ( open bars ) in both , the absence or presence of MTb infection .

<extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNAs , the expression of which are <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent and - independent , respectively , during MTb infection , were measured as controls .

( C , D ) <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are required for MTb induction of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in human monocytes .

THP-1 cells that constitutively express lentivirally-delivered <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - or <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific shRNA were constructed as described in Materials and Methods .
THP-1 cells expressing control <extra_id_0> shRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were used as described in 7B .
Cells were infected with MTb strain CDC1551 or left uninfected for 16 hours at 37degreesC , and RNA was analyzed .

<extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was significantly inhibited in the MTb-infected cells expressing either <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( C ) or <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( D ) shRNA ( black bars ) compared to cells expressing control <extra_id_0> shRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( open bars ) .

<extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNAs , both of which require <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to be induced by PRR activation , were measured as controls .
